Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and describe the purpose of comparing plant and animal diversity in different habitats.
The student can draw a land habitat (e.g., playground, garden, forest) with observations of different living things like trees, grasses, or squirrels.
The student can draw a water habitat (e.g., pond, stream, lake) with observations of different living things like fish or flowering plants.
The student can record observations of the different types of living things in each habitat, using detailed and labeled illustrations.
The student can compare the types of living things found in each habitat and identify patterns of diversity.
The student can organize and explain their drawings to show evidence of plant and animal diversity across the two habitats.
